DOC.brief_title: Paclitaxel/Cisplatin/Fluorouracil Followed by Paclitaxel/Cisplatin/Radiotherapy and Esophagectomy for Esophageal Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: We hypothesize that one-cycle induction chemotherapy may also help to identify chemo-responsive esophageal cancer patients who are highly treatable by definitive CCRT.in order to test this hypothesis, we thus propose this phase II clinical study to verify the role of "response to one-cycle induction chemotherapy"in the prediction of pathologic complete response rate to CCRT and tje outcomes for patients with loco-regional esophageal cancer.
DOC.criteria: Pathologically proven esophageal cancer Locally advanced diseases T3 N01 M0; T13 N1 M0; T13 or N01 M1a Age ≥ 18 years old ECOG ≤ 2 Creatinine < 1.5 mg/dl AST, ALT < 2.5 x upper normal limits Bilirubin < 2.0 mg/dl WBC > 4,000/μl or ANC>2,000/μl Platelet > 100,000//μl Informed consent Invasion to surrounding organs (T4 disease) Distant mets (except M1a) Prior thoracic irradiation Presence of other squamous cell carcinoma of aerodigestive way Symptomatic comorbid diseases Previous malignancy
